intro: Eleocharis constricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct, compressed appearance. Eleocharis constricta plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and stabilizing soil.
